Anniversary of Independence of Democratic Congo Observed 
    Pyongyang, June 30 (KCNA) -- A meeting took place at the Chollima House of Culture Wednesday to mark the 45th anniversary of the Independence of Democratic Congo.
 A speech by the chairman of the friendship association was followed by an adoption of a message of greetings to the president of Democratic Congo.

Indian Diplomats Help Korean Farmers 
    Pyongyang, June 30 (KCNA) -- N. T. Khankhup, Indian ambassador to the DPRK, and staff members of the Indian embassy helped the DPRK-India Friendship Kalchon Co-operative Farm in South Phyongan Province in weeding bean field Wednesday.
 During a break, they enjoyed an art performance given by the schoolchildren and conversed with the farmers, deepening the friendship.    
 The Indian ambassador wished the farmers greater success in the agricultural production, noting that the DPRK is focusing its efforts on agriculture this year.
 That day the guests handed aid materials to the farm.

articles.title: Anti-War Rally and Protest in S. Korea
Headquarters of University Movement Formed in S. Korea
articles.content:
Anti-War Rally and Protest in S. Korea 
    Pyongyang, June 30 (KCNA) -- The Democratic Workers' Party of south Korea and civic and social organizations including the People's Action against Troop Dispatch reportedly held an anti-war rally in Seoul on June 26 and demanded that the Jaitun unit be withdrawn from Iraq at an early date to prevent the second and third cases of Kim Son Il. The rally was held on the lapse of one year since Kim Son Il, a south Korean civilian, was killed in Iraq.
 Kim Hye Gyong, representative of the Democratic Workers' Party, Jong Tae Yon, planning chief of the People's Action against Troop Dispatch, and other speakers called on the people to turn out in the movement against war, declaring that the struggle would continue till the war of aggression in Iraq ended.    
 The resolution said the movement for peace against war must be expanded to put an end to the presence of the south Korean Jaitun unit in Iraq and its occupation by U.S. troops. It stated that the massive struggle demanding the withdrawal of the dispatched troops would be intensified around August, one year after the dispatch of troops to Iraq.
 At the end of the rally, the participants started a protest march, chanting "Remember Kim Son Il", "The U.S., leave Iraq".

Greetings to Burundian President
Kim Yong Nam Receives Credentials from Zambian Ambassador
articles.content:
Greetings to Burundian President
    Pyongyang, June 30 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Wednesday sent a message of greetings to Burundian President Domitien Ndayzeye on the occasion of the 43rd anniversary of the  independence of the country.
 Expressing the belief that the friendly ties between the two countries would continue to grow stronger, the message wished the president and the people of Burundi greater success in their work for national unity and peace, stability and reconstruction of the country.

Kim Yong Nam Receives Credentials from Zambian Ambassador
    Pyongyang, June 30 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, received credentials from Zambian Ambassador e. p. David Clifford Saviye at the Mansudae Assembly Hall today.
 Present there were Vice-Minister of Foreign Affairs Choe Su Hon and staff members of the Zambian embassy here.    
 After receiving the credentials, Kim Yong Nam talked with the ambassador.
